name: Morris Museum of Art, Portraiture 2
description: 2021-10-24 trip to Augusta, GA. Upon walking into the traditional museum setting, I couldn't help but notice the contrasting pink walls and thick blue carpet. The pink walls seemed like a unique contemporary decision in my opinion, intentional or not. The exhibition design revealed how the museum captured "whiteness" in its portraiture collection. The room felt dream-like, and lost in time. There was a curated piece of history left out of this showcase. The exhibition made me think about my own home town in South Dakota, and how often I never payed attention to what culture and history was curated in front of me. It seems cyclical? Was the director aware too?
